content.rendered:
Oriya Ayimalk Goshen, a 21-year-old from Jerusalem, served with distinction in the elite reconnaissance unit of the Givati Brigade. His unwavering commitment to the defense of Israel led him to the heart of the Iron Swords War, a conflict sparked by the devastating events of October 7, 2023, when Hamas terrorists launched a brutal attack on Israeli civilians. On January 17, 2024, Oriya tragically fell in combat with terrorists in southern Gaza. His bravery and sacrifice symbolize the resilience and dedication of those who fight to protect their homeland.

Family Life

Oriya was born and raised in Jerusalem, a city steeped in history and culture, where he absorbed a deep sense of connection to his heritage and community. His family remembers him as the heart of their home, a son and brother whose optimism and compassion brightened every moment. Oriya’s father reflected on their shared journey, emphasizing the profound lessons he learned from his son’s short but impactful life. Oriya’s mother and siblings shared emotional tributes, recalling his ability to spread joy and forge strong bonds, leaving an indelible mark on all who knew him.

Military Service

From a young age, Oriya displayed a remarkable combination of charisma, strength, and determination. These traits made him a natural fit for the elite reconnaissance unit of the Givati Brigade, where he served with pride and exceptional dedication. As a member of this prestigious unit, Oriya took part in critical missions, demonstrating courage and leadership in the face of adversity. During the Iron Swords War, he fought on the front lines, embodying the spirit of Israel’s defenders. His final act of heroism in southern Gaza is a testament to his unyielding resolve to protect his nation, even at the cost of his own life.

Professional Life

Oriya’s life was defined by his vibrant personality and drive to make a difference. A graduate of the Hanaton pre-military academy, he stood out for his intellectual curiosity, empathy, and sense of humor. Gad Spector, the head of the academy, described Oriya as a young man who balanced gentleness with strength, constantly uplifting and challenging those around him. Oriya’s time at the academy was marked by his ability to forge deep connections and lead by example, qualities that carried over into his military service and everyday interactions.

Legacy

Oriya’s legacy lives on through the love and admiration of his family, friends, and comrades. Often referred to as the “glue” of his social circles, he had an extraordinary gift for bringing people together, creating unity and laughter in the face of challenges. His life serves as a beacon of hope, demonstrating the power of optimism, courage, and selflessness. At his funeral, held at the Mount Herzl Military Cemetery, Oriya’s family spoke of the joy he brought into their lives and the strength he displayed in every endeavor.

Oriya Ayimalk Goshen’s story is a reminder of the profound sacrifices made by Israel’s defenders. His courage and compassion continue to inspire all who knew him, embodying the ideals of resilience, unity, and unwavering devotion to his country. May his memory be a blessing and his heroism a guiding light for generations to come.

First Name

Oriya Ayimalk

Last Name

Goshen

Age

21

Fell On

Army Unit

Givati Brigade

Army Rank

staff sergeant

יהי זכרו ברוך

excerpt.rendered: Brave Givati soldier known for his charisma, joy, and ultimate sacrifice defending Israel.
